content.description: An inductor with an inductance of <math alttext="0.30 henrys" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></math> is connected in series with a resistor and a variable power supply, as shown. The current in the inductor as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is modeled by <math alttext="I equals, I sub 0, end subscript, times, open parenthesis, 1 minus a t, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> where <math alttext="I sub 0, end subscript, equals 4.0 amps" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="a equals 0.5 inverse seconds" overflow="scroll"> <mi>a</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0.5</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <msup> <mtext>s</mtext> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </math>.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the potential difference across the inductor at time <math alttext="t equals 1.0 second" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>s</mtext> </math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
